Calibration

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/fit.R
fit.Rd

Builds a calibration curve for gamma dose rate estimation.

fit(object, noise, ...)

# S4 method for GammaSpectra,GammaSpectrum
fit(object, noise, range = c(200,
  2800), intercept = TRUE, weights = FALSE, details = NULL, ...)

# S4 method for GammaSpectra,numeric
fit(object, noise, range = c(200, 2800),
  intercept = TRUE, weights = FALSE, details = NULL, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class GammaSpectra.
noise

A list of two numeric values giving the noise value and error.
...

Currently not used.
range

A length-two numeric vector giving the energy range to integrate within (in keV).
intercept

A logical scalar: should the intercept of the curve be estimated?
weights

A logical scalar: should weights be used in the fitting process. If TRUE, the inverse of the squared dose errors are used.
details

A list of character vector specifying additional informations about the instrument for which the curve is built.

Value

A CalibrationCurve object.

Details

TODO

See also

integrateSignal

Other dose rate: predict

Examples

# Import CNF files for calibration
spc_dir <- system.file("extdata/crp2a/calibration", package = "gamma")
spc_calib <- read(spc_dir, skip = TRUE)

# Set dose rate values and errors for each spectrum
data("clermont")
setDoseRate(spc_calib) <- clermont[, c("gamma", "gamma_error")]

# Build the calibration curve
calib_curve <- fit(
  spc_calib,
  noise = c(value = 1190, error = 1),
  range = c(200, 2800)
)

# Check the linear model
summary(calib_curve[["model"]])
#> 
#> Call:
#> stats::lm(formula = fit_formula, data = fit_data, weights = fit_weights)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>       1       2       3       4       5       6       7 
#>  -7.683  13.381  -3.229 -53.579  23.502  -9.187  36.796 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  -8.649e+02  4.755e+01  -18.19 9.23e-06 ***
#> signal_value  3.442e-02  6.835e-04   50.36 5.84e-08 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 31.97 on 5 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.998,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9976 
#> F-statistic:  2536 on 1 and 5 DF,  p-value: 5.837e-08
#> 

# Plot the curve
plot(calib_curve) +
  ggplot2::labs(x = "Signal", y = "Dose rate [µGy/y]")

# Estimate gamma dose rates
(dose_rate <- predict(calib_curve, spc_calib))
#> $BRIQUE
